com.dautelle.realtime
Class ConcurrentContext

java.lang.Object
  com.dautelle.realtime.Context
      com.dautelle.realtime.ConcurrentContext
public final class ConcurrentContext
extends Context

This class represents a concurrent context; it is used to accelerate execution of concurrent algorithms on multi-processors systems.

When a thread enters a concurrent context, it may perform concurrent executions by calling the execute(java.lang.Runnable) static method.

Only after all concurrent executions are completed, is the current thread allowed to exit the scope of the concurrent context (internal synchronization).

Concurrent context are easy to use, and provide automatic load-balancing between processors with almost no overhead. To avoid thread proliferation, the maximum concurrency is limited by the context local concurrency limit.

Here is an example of concurrent implementation of the Fibonacci numbers calculations:

     // F(n) = F(n-1) + F(n-2) for n > 1
     static LargeInteger fibonacci(LargeInteger n) {
         if (n.compareTo(ONE) <= 0) {
             return n;
         }
         LocalContext.enter();
         try {
             N.setValue(n);
             ConcurrentContext.enter();
             try {
                 ConcurrentContext.execute(FIBONNACI_1);
                 ConcurrentContext.execute(FIBONNACI_2);
             } finally {
                 ConcurrentContext.exit(); // Waits for concurrent threads to finish.
             }
             LargeInteger r1 = (LargeInteger) R_1.getValue();
             LargeInteger r2 = (LargeInteger) R_2.getValue();
             return r1.add(r2);
         } finally {
             LocalContext.exit();
         }
     }
     private static final Runnable FIBONNACI_1 = new Runnable() {
         public void run() {
             LargeInteger n = (LargeInteger) N.getValue();
             R_1.setValue(fibonacci(n.subtract(ONE)));
         }
     };
     private static final Runnable FIBONNACI_2 = new Runnable() {
         public void run() {
             LargeInteger n = (LargeInteger) N.getValue();
             R_2.setValue(fibonacci(n.subtract(TWO)));
         }
     };
     private static final LocalContext.Variable N = new LocalContext.Variable();
     private static final LocalContext.Variable R_1 = new LocalContext.Variable();
     private static final LocalContext.Variable R_2 = new LocalContext.Variable();

Note: If the execute(java.lang.Runnable) method is called while in a pool context, the concurrent thread is executed within a local pool context. Upon completion of the execution the local pool context is cleared. Future versions may avoid clearing the pool by synchronizing the local pool exit with the outer pool exit. But this feature has not been implemented yet.

Version:
6.0, January 18, 2003
Author:
Jean-Marie Dautelle

Method Summary
static void enter()
          Enters a ConcurrentContext.
static void execute(java.lang.Runnable logic)
          Executes the specified logic by a concurrent thread unless the concurrency limit has been reached in which case the logic is executed by the current thread.
static void exit()
          Exits a ConcurrentContext.
static int getConcurrency()
          Returns the local concurrency limit or system-wise concurrency if this method is called outside of a local context (default Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors() * 2 ).
static void setConcurrency(int limit)
          Sets the maximum number of concurrent threads running in the current local context (or system-wise if this method is called outside of a local context).

Method Detail

setConcurrency

public static void setConcurrency(int limit)
Sets the maximum number of concurrent threads running in the current local context (or system-wise if this method is called outside of a local context). For example, the following disables concurrency: ConcurrencyContext.setConcurrency(0)

Parameters:
limit - the concurrency limit within the current LocalContext.

getConcurrency

public static int getConcurrency()
Returns the local concurrency limit or system-wise concurrency if this method is called outside of a local context (default Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors() * 2 ).

Returns:
the concurrency limit within the current LocalContext.
See Also:
setConcurrency(int)

enter

public static void enter()
Enters a ConcurrentContext.

execute

public static void execute(java.lang.Runnable logic)
                    throws ConcurrentException
Executes the specified logic by a concurrent thread unless the concurrency limit has been reached in which case the logic is executed by the current thread. The concurrent execution is always performed within the Context of the current thread (e.g. executes in a PoolContext if the current thread is in a PoolContext). Any exception or error during execution is propagated upon exit() of the concurrent context.

Parameters:
logic - the logic to execute concurrently if possible.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the current context is not a ConcurrentContext.
ConcurrentException

exit

public static void exit()
                 throws ConcurrentException
Exits a ConcurrentContext. This method blocks until all execute(java.lang.Runnable) called within the current context are completed. Errors and exceptions raised in concurrent threads are propagated here.

Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the current context is not a ConcurrentContext.
ConcurrentException - propagates any error or exception raised during the execution of a concurrent thread.
